summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling and detailing the arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It outlines COVID-19 protocols, public access via video feed and teleconference, and requires the government and defense to notify the court of any victims or family members wishing to attend.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, issuing the order regarding the arraignment logistics.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B.

events.title: Deadline for Attendance Notification
events.description: Deadline for the Government to notify the court if any alleged victims wish to attend the arraignment, and for defense counsel to notify if any of Maxwell's family members wish to attend.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
Due to significant public interest and COVID-19, the court arranged for a public video feed, overflow rooms, and a public teleconference line for up to 4,000 listeners.
The court ordered the government to identify any alleged victims wishing to attend and the defense to identify any of Maxwell's family members wishing to attend by April 21, 2021.
Strict COVID-19 protocols, including mask requirements and temperature checks, were mandated for courthouse entry.
The order was issued by United States District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
